column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Blaste's fraught expression is in stark contrast to the tranquil surroundings.
Search for a chestnut-haired lady.
Speak with Blaste.
Ah, we meet again. The familiar who was with Charmion, yes? My apologies if I seem a little distracted, but I am actually in the midst of searching for someone.
Oh, I don't believe we've met. As much as I would like to engage in more meaningful conversation, I am actually in the midst of searching for someone.

It's my mentor, who taught me practically everything I know. Now, she has relinquished her role and is ready to make her final journey. But before she does, there is an important matter I must convey to her.
The last concept in her care─a beautiful, winged creature─has been approved for life on Etheirys!

Please, will you help me look for her? There is a strong chance you will find her at Philomythes Notos. Her most distinguishing feature is her chestnut-colored hair, tied into a single, flowing lock, much like a monoceros's tail.
I have sent a familiar of my own to the north to look for my mentor. I would be very grateful if you could search elsewhere, starting with Philomythes Notos.
You wish to speak with me?
Ah, yes. I had a feeling she might say that. As I have told her, my decision has been made.
What will you say?
But what about that winged creature? It was a success!
Well, she can't say I didn't try.
Glad tidings, to be certain, but my work is done. This news was more than sufficient, and I thank you for it.
Nothing can deter me from my chosen course, and I must join my predecessors in the hereafter. Tell Blaste to name the creature as she pleases... And that I wish her every happiness.
Now, our brief encounter has reached its end. Farewell.
She's not with you...did you at least find her?
I should've known nothing would sway her. All I can do is hope she finds blessed respite in the aetherial sea...and that we may one day be reunited in another life.
Until then, I will carry on her legacy, beginning with the naming of the creature she cared for so dearly. I think I shall name it after her. That way, she will live on through her work...forever.
